meanings.definition: Of or relating to a group of three.
meanings.sent1: The triadic friendship between Lily, Sarah, and Emma was unbreakable.
meanings.sent2: The triadic nature of the project required input from all team members.
meanings.sent3: The triadic arrangement of chairs in the room made it look perfectly balanced.
meanings.sent4: The triadic harmony of colors in the painting created a sense of completeness.
meanings.sent5: The triadic relationship between the three characters added depth to the storyline.

meanings.sent1: The triadic negotiation process was complex but fair.
meanings.sent2: The triadic discussion included representatives from each department.
meanings.sent3: The triadic division of tasks among the siblings led to a fair distribution of work.
meanings.sent4: The triadic balance of power in the government ensured no single entity had too much control.
meanings.sent5: The triadic partnership among the companies brought stability to the market.

meanings.definition: Consisting of three parts or components.
meanings.sent1: The triadic structure of the molecule made it stable.
meanings.sent2: The triadic design of the building incorporated three main sections.
meanings.sent3: The triadic breakdown of the budget helped allocate resources efficiently.
meanings.sent4: The triadic relationship between body, mind, and soul is essential for overall well-being.
meanings.sent5: The triadic composition of the music piece gave it a unique sound.
